metadata.name: Winter Waterbuck
metadata.description:
It is mid-August, you might think of a sunny beach, white sands, and a cocktail in your hand, yet here in South Africa it is winter. However, winter does not mean snow in the Kruger,  since there is hardly a cloud in the sky, you will most likely even catch some sun as you walk through the low and dry savanna grass. While walking you spot a majestic waterbuck, one of the largest antelopes in the park, rays of sunlight turning his fur into a layer of gold. A truly unimaginable scene, which no one would believe if it weren't to be captured on camera. You get your camera out, and manage to take the once in a lifetime shot. This 1 of 5 edition is the great capture of a scene that is only to be seen in dreams. 

Location: The Kruger National Park, South Africa
